items.sentence: That's not the main reason Tom has to do that.

You may find something you like in that store.

How can we tell what's right and what's wrong?
Where were you yesterday? You weren't at home.
Compiling a dictionary requires a lot of time.
I think those people over there are Canadians.
What Tom suggested provoked a long discussion.
Did Tom say where he was going for the summer?
Tom and Mary are reading books in their rooms.
Have you read the book Tom wrote about Boston?
Tom wasn't the first to encourage me to do so.
I haven't given anybody permission to do that.
More than thirty thousand people participated.
No cameras or cell phones are allowed in here.
Tom was happy with the gift that you gave him.

You know that I've changed my mind, don't you?

Tom will be on the same plane that I'll be on.
I'm going to Australia for a couple of months.
I'm going to the beach the day after tomorrow.
Mary was the prettiest girl Tom had ever seen.

My life would be completely empty without you.

No matter what the cost, I'll accomplish that.

Let's not discuss this until I've had a drink.

You shouldn't drink coffee this late at night.
